alert.note: Alert for Lonoke; Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 8:56AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Lonoke, east central Saline and southeastern Pulaski Counties through 930 AM CDT... At 855 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ironton, or near Southwest Little Rock, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Sherwood... Bryant... Downtown Little Rock... Southwest Little Rock... Shannon Hills... Wrightsville... Argenta... Ironton... Estes... Toltec Mounds State Park... East End... Protho Junction... Sweet Home... Lakewood... Geyer Springs... Mabelvale... McAlmont... State Fairgrounds... This includes the following highways... Interstate 30 between mile markers 128 and 142. Interstate 40 between mile markers 153 and 160. Interstate 530 between mile markers 1 and 16. Interstate 630 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 440 between mile markers 1 and 11. US Highway 67 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
